skills.title: Mainland vs Free Zone Business Setup
skills.content: Mainland (DED): 100% foreign ownership since 2021 FDI law, can trade anywhere in UAE and internationally, requires local office/Ejari, higher setup cost but more flexibility. Free Zone: 100% foreign ownership always, trade restricted to within free zone + international (no direct UAE mainland trade without distributor), package deals (license + visa + office), lower cost and faster setup but limited scope. Key free zones: DMCC, DIFC, ADGM, JAFZA, DAFZA.
procedures: Step 1: Determine business activity and target market
Step 2: Choose mainland vs free zone based on needs
Step 3: Apply for initial approval from relevant authority
Step 4: Reserve trade name
Step 5: Prepare MOA/AOA
Step 6: Obtain external approvals if required
Step 7: Pay fees and collect trade license

skills.title: UAE Corporate Tax Regime
skills.content: 9% corporate tax on profits above AED 375,000 (effective June 2023, Federal Decree-Law No. 47/2022). 0% on profits up to AED 375,000. Free zone entities may qualify for 0% on qualifying income if they meet substance requirements. VAT at 5% since January 2018. Companies must register with Federal Tax Authority (FTA), maintain proper books, file annual returns.
procedures: Step 1: Register for corporate tax with FTA
Step 2: Maintain proper accounting records
Step 3: File annual corporate tax return
Step 4: Pay tax within 9 months of financial year end

skills.title: DED Trade License Application
skills.content: DED trade license types: Commercial (trading), Professional (services), Industrial (manufacturing). Process: choose activity from DED list → get initial approval → choose trade name → prepare MOA → get external approvals (if required) → pay fees → receive license. Approximate costs: AED 15,000-30,000 for initial setup depending on activity.
procedures: Step 1: Select business activity from DED approved list
Step 2: Apply for initial approval
Step 3: Reserve trade name (AED 620)
Step 4: Submit all documents
Step 5: Pay license fees (~AED 15,000-30,000)
Step 6: Collect trade license

skills.title: UBO Disclosure & ESR Requirements
skills.content: Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO) disclosure required for all UAE entities under Cabinet Resolution No. 58/2020. Must submit within 60 days of incorporation. Economic Substance Regulations (ESR) require entities engaged in relevant activities to demonstrate adequate economic substance in UAE (real office, staff, expenditure). Non-compliance carries heavy penalties.
procedures: Step 1: Identify UBOs (25%+ ownership or significant control)
Step 2: Submit UBO disclosure within 60 days of incorporation
Step 3: File annual ESR notification
Step 4: Maintain substance requirements if engaged in relevant activities
